page.title: 06FRODSHAM HILL
page.content: Frodsham Hill is a tree covered sandstone outcrop standing 146m above sea-level.It has commanding views of the surrounding area and on a clear day you can see up to seven counties. On top there is a War Memorial to the dead of the two World Wars.The Memorial is a sandstone pinnacle about 10m tall.Along side the Memorial is a one storey building called 'The Mersey View'.This is a night club offering live cabaret,dining and dancing.There are plans at present to build a hotel complex to comprise 30 bedrooms and leisure facilities next door to the existing buildings.Also on the top of the hill are two radio masts used for communication.The hill itself is a place of natural beauty and a resource for leisure activities such as walking It is the start of the Sandstone Trail , a major ramblers walk in Cheshire.
